p: While rbST is banned in the European Union, Canada, Japan, Australia, and New Zealand [ 10], the drug is approved in the United States, despite substantial controversy. One of the primary welfare concerns associated with the increased milk production caused by rbST is the potential risk for mastitis. Some of the initial studies on rbST indicated that its use was linked to an increase (for example, Burton et al., 1990 [ 123] and Pell et al., 1992 [ 124], but see White et al., 1994 [ 53] for counter examples).
